intro: Erythraea centaurium var. laxa, commonly known as the laxa variant of the red centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variant is typically found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
